Quick Start Guide
Create UserDesktop ClientInstallation with Docker (port 8080)Manual Installation

Desktop Client

This guide provides instructions on connecting to ownCloud server using Desktop or Mobile Client. You can download the latest version of the ownCloud Desktop Synchronization Client from the ownCloud download page for Linux, macOS, or Microsoft Windows.

Linux users must have a password manager enabled, such as GNOME Keyring or KWallet, so that the sync client can login automatically.

System Requirements

  • Windows 7+
  • Mac OS X 10.10+ (64-bit only)
  • CentOS 7.6+ & 8
  • Debian 9.0 & 10
  • Fedora 30 & 31 & 32
  • Ubuntu 18.04 & 19.04 & 19.10 & 20.04
  • openSUSE Leap 15.0 & 15.1 & 15.2

Installation

Launch the .msi file and configure it in the wizard that pops up. The installation wizard takes you step-by-step through configuration options and account setup.

  1. Enter the URL of your ownCloud server

  2. Enter your ownCloud login

  3. Sync all of your files on the ownCloud server on the Local Folder option The default local sync folder is ownCloud.

  4. Click the “Connect” button
  5. Click the Connect to your ownCloud Web GUI button
